concise_definition: n. 板岩, 石板; v. 安排, 提名, 计划

definitions.explanation_en: A type of fine-grained, metamorphic rock that can be split into thin, flat sheets, commonly used for roofing, flooring, or writing surfaces.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种细粒变质岩，可分裂成薄而平坦的片状，常用于屋顶、地板或书写板。
definitions.example_en: The old schoolhouse had a slate roof that had lasted over a century.
definitions.example_cn: 那所旧校舍的屋顶是石板做的，已经使用了一百多年。

definitions.explanation_en: A small, flat piece of slate used for writing or drawing, especially in schools before the advent of paper and chalkboards.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种小型的石板片，过去常用于学校书写或绘画，早于纸张和黑板的使用。
definitions.example_en: Children in the 19th century practiced their spelling on slates with chalk.
definitions.example_cn: 19世纪的孩子们用粉笔在石板上练习拼写。

definitions.explanation_en: A list of candidates nominated together for election, especially in political contexts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在政治语境中，指一组被共同提名参选的候选人名单。
definitions.example_en: The party unveiled its slate of candidates for the upcoming election.
definitions.example_cn: 该政党公布了即将选举的候选人名单。

definitions.explanation_en: To schedule or plan something for a particular time or purpose, often formally or officially.
definitions.explanation_cn: 正式或官方地安排某事在特定时间发生或用于特定目的。
definitions.example_en: The meeting is slated for next Tuesday at 3 p.m.
definitions.example_cn: 会议定于下周二下午三点举行。

definitions.explanation_en: To nominate someone for a position or role, especially in a political or organizational context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 提名某人担任某一职位或角色，尤其在政治或组织语境中。
definitions.example_en: She was slated to become the next CEO of the company.
definitions.example_cn: 她被提名为公司下一任首席执行官。

definitions.explanation_en: To criticize or condemn someone severely, often publicly or in writing.
definitions.explanation_cn: 公开或书面严厉批评或谴责某人。
definitions.example_en: The newspaper slated the mayor for his handling of the budget crisis.
definitions.example_cn: 这家报纸严厉批评了市长对预算危机的处理方式。

comparison.analysis: “Plan” (计划) 是一个通用词，泛指为未来行动制定的方案，不带有正式提名或安排的含义。而 “slate” 作为动词时，特指正式或官方地安排某人或某事，常用于政治、组织或媒体语境，语义更具体、更具权威性。
“Nominate” (提名) 仅指正式推荐某人担任职位，而 “slate” 不仅包含提名，还隐含了将候选人作为一组整体推出，常用于政党或选举的集体提名语境。此外，“slate” 还可作名词表示整个提名名单，而 “nominate” 无此用法。
“Rock” (岩石) 是一个广义词，泛指所有天然矿物固体，而 “slate” 是一种特定类型的岩石，具有可分裂成薄片的物理特性。两者是种属关系，不能互换。
“Criticize” (批评) 是中性或通用的动词，可指任何程度的负面评价。而 “slate” 作为动词时，语气更强烈，常带有公开、严厉甚至带有媒体渲染色彩的谴责意味，语义色彩更重。
